title: Patriots stock watch: Here’s who stood out and struggled in Super Bowl loss to Seahawks
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Christian Gonzalez and Craig Woodson excelled in Patriots' Super Bowl LX loss, with Gonzalez making crucial pass deflections.
New England's offensive line struggled, allowing six sacks and failing to establish a ground game against the Seattle defense.
Drake Maye fumbled and struggled under pressure, while Stefon Diggs was limited to three catches in the Patriots' 29-13 defeat.

title: What an emotional Drake Maye said of Super Bowl LX loss
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Drake Maye's three turnovers contributed to the New England Patriots' 29-13 loss to the Seattle Seahawks in Super Bowl LX.
Seattle's defense dominated with six sacks and 11 QB hits, disrupting New England's previously strong offensive performance.
Despite the loss, Maye praised his teammates and expressed optimism about the Patriots' future roster improvements.

title: Super Bowl 2026: Bad Bunny performs joyful, controversy-free halftime show
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Bad Bunny delivered a joyful, controversy-free halftime show at Super Bowl 60 featuring Latin culture in Santa Clara, California.
Guest performers included Lady Gaga and Ricky Martin, with a surprise salsa rendition of 'Die With A Smile.'
The performance faced criticism from President Trump, but concluded with a unifying message of love and togetherness.

title: Super Bowl celebrities: Here’s who was spotted in Santa Clara
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Jay-Z, Blue Ivy, Peyton Manning, and Tom Brady were among celebrities at Super Bowl LX in Santa Clara.
Bad Bunny headlined the halftime show with guest appearances from Lady Gaga, Cardi B, and Karol G.
Notable attendees included Justin Bieber, Hailey Bieber, Paige Bueckers, Dave Grohl, Kendall Jenner, and 21 Savage.

title: Mass. State Police report fake account impersonating trooper
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Massachusetts State Police warn about a fake Instagram account impersonating a female trooper with over 100,000 followers.
The account named 'Sarita' uses AI-generated content and links to an OnlyFans page with adult material.
The same model reportedly impersonates a Santa Monica officer, and police urge reliance on verified sources for information.

title: In Patriots territory, Seahawks fans find a home base for the Super Bowl
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Alma Cantina and White Bull Tavern in Boston hosted a Seahawks Super Bowl watch party.
The partnership began when Brenna Stuart of the Boston Seahawks Fan group sought a dedicated venue.
Seahawks fans in Boston find community while watching games in a predominantly Patriots region.

title: Watch: Patriots’ Stefon Diggs shoved to the ground as punches fly during sideline scuffle
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots' Stefon Diggs and Seattle's Josh Jobe were involved in a sideline altercation during a game.
No penalties or ejections occurred despite Jobe shoving Diggs and punches being thrown.
Diggs is facing unrelated assault charges with a court arraignment scheduled for February 13.

title: Green Line service suspended between Park Street and Government Center after train derails
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: A Green Line trolley derailed at Park Street, suspending service between Park Street and Government Center, says MBTA.
The MBTA announced on X that the train was rerailed at 6:43 p.m. after the 2:46 p.m. suspension.
Service remains suspended as of Sunday night while MBTA inspects and repairs the Park Street platform.

title: ‘Good Will Dunkin’: Watch Ben Affleck, Tom Brady, Jennifer Aniston, and more in 2026 Super Bowl commercial
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Ben Affleck stars in Dunkin' 2026 Super Bowl ad parodying 'Good Will Hunting' with Tom Brady and '90s sitcom celebrities.
The commercial features Alfonso Ribeiro, Jason Alexander, Ted Danson, Jaleel White, Jasmine Guy, Jennifer Aniston, and Matt LeBlanc.
Set as a sitcom, the ad aired before Super Bowl LX halftime, showcasing nostalgic themes and Boston references.

title: Here’s Ann Michael Maye’s custom look for Super Bowl Sunday
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Ann Michael Maye attended Super Bowl LX wearing a custom Patriots jacket by Kristin Juszczyk, paired with studded white jeans.
Maye, married to Patriots quarterback Drake Maye, posted supportive messages on social media, skipping Thursday's NFL Honors ceremony.
Ann Michael Maye gained social media fame during the 2025 NFL season through viral baking videos and a partnership with NBC10 Boston.
